urls.title: Demand Action on Flooding and Sewage in Our Rivers
urls.description: It should be illegal to pump untreated sewage into rivers and we shouldn't build houses in places where it makes flooding worse.

tweets.text: @bostonflood @BostonRowingUK @EnvAgency What is it? I can see something but can't work out what it is.

In the #LandscapestoLifescapes exhibition we've brought environmental & social sciences together to explore the causes & consequences of #flooding. Too often these perspectives are falsely separated @TheEPS1 @TheBDMA  @TheFloodHub @EnvAgencyNW #SciComm https://t.co/SZ2uFbrG84

Poor old @EnvAgency the wheels really are coming off the bus.

2019/20 target for "Kms of rivers enhanced", 2,300. 

Achieved? 1,753. Oops.

Target for 20/21 3,900.

Achieved in Q1? 31. Yes, that's right 31. Double oops.

PS. Can anyone tell me what "Enhanced", actually means? https://t.co/oa1m2WCN5V

So apart from the totally meaningless corporate performance target "kms of rivers enhanced", it appears the @EnvAgency have pulled another funny with "reducing pollution incidents". Just make it go away, don't bother reporting it. "Trebles all round." üòÇ

https://t.co/7r5OGuYYQc

@RosieP4 @Feargal_Sharkey @RachSalv @MonicaHone @SmartGrowthUK According to @NatInfraCom monitoring report ‚Äúdemands on England‚Äôs water and wastewater systems are increasing‚Äù Yet @TheENDSReport the @EnvAgency ‚Äúdrops pollution reporting‚Äù https://t.co/BhVRurkuFB
@GaryHal59934318 @BBCNWT @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency Haha! You know me üòÇ

urls.title: Community information about Coastal Defences at Chiswell and West Bay ‚Äì Dorset Coast Forum
urls.description: The Dorset Coast Forum, in partnership with the Environment Agency and Dorset Council, has released an updated version of the ‚ÄòStorms and Coastal Defences at Chiswell‚Äô booklet. The storms witnessed at the end of January prompted an update to the booklet which was originally released in 2014 after recent winter storms. The booklet was produced for Chiswell residents on Portland to help inform the community on what to do in a storm event, explain how the coastal defences work and what may happen in the

urls.title: To flush or not to flush? The results are in from our wet wipe survey
urls.description: Late last year we surveyed the UK‚Äôs high street retailers to find out how they‚Äôre performing when it comes to testing, labelling and removing plastic from their own brand wet wipes and sanitary products.

tweets.text:
@mcsuk have released results from their wet wipe survey: https://t.co/2g3FPLIOU7

Many wet wipes contain plastic, therefore should NOT be flushed down the toiletüöΩ‚ùå

Wet wipes contribute to beach litter, fatbergs, & also microplastic pollution in our seas.

#unflushables https://t.co/i9q279Vttg

@DrEdHenderson @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA Yep that map is from end of Jan so although it‚Äôs an illustration of how wet everything is generally the specifics will have shifted - esp given Feb‚Äôs rainfall stats. Cumbria has had much more if late than it did in Jan I suspect.

tweets.text: @PondManUK @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency To this : https://t.co/CnFs3FdKyr

The Environment Agency has dropped pollution incident reporting from its latest scorecard. We've asked them why. Will let you know when they get back to us!
https://t.co/jWafesYQh1

A week ago, oil pollution began entering the Peak Forest Canal at Furness Vale. We contacted @CanalRiverTrust EVERY DAY. After 5 days of inaction we went public to get them to take it seriously. We thought they had, but a week later the spill is spreading and worsening. 1/3 https://t.co/tD9bGkkFik

The @EnvAgency has launched a consultation on how it determines water-stress in England and we're encouraging our members to take part. You have until 11 March 2021 to have your say. Visit NFU Online for more information üëâhttps://t.co/mJR9LSYQIM https://t.co/bwqqo0BMAJ
